result.execSummary:
The defendant ASHLEY J VANTASSEL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ASHLEY J VANTASSEL

records.addlTxt:
1:11 PM Defendant ASHLEY J VANTASSEL in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Larry J. Lloyd in court for ASHLEY J VANTASSEL. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 as repeater with probation and conditions and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in. DA concurs. Atty Lloyd concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Lloyd. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:

-AODA and any follow-up. Unless the agent deems she has done one recently.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Court costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 1:19 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Response to State's Discovery Demand
Return date on June 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant ASHLEY J VANTASSEL in court.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Statement by the defendant, did apply for public defender and does qualify. Court sets for Status of counsel on May 17, 2022 at 10:00 AM
Second appearance scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on May 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Second appearance on March 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:20 AM Defendant ASHLEY J VANTASSEL appeared by video, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Court determines defendant stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on her behalf. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court gives defendant two weeks to sign bond and complete processing or a warrant may be issued. Court will set for Status Hearing of Counsel March 23, 2022 at 11:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:23 AM.
Initial appearance on February 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant called and requested an adjournment as her son came home from his dad's house and is sick. Adjourned to February 22, 2022 at 9:30 AM.  Address on file has been confirmed and telephone number has been updated.
